definition: A constraint that may appear in the flow shop environment is that the queues in front of each machine operate according to the First In First Out (FIFO) discipline. This implies that the order (or permutation) in which the jobs go through the first machine is maintained throughout the system.
source_document_of_definition: Scheduling -  Theory, Algorithms, and Systems, 2016, ISBN: 978-3-319-26578-0
